name: 王泰典
objective:
Course Objective:
Help the students develop skills for applying statistical methods and related tools in engineering practices and research fields.
Course Description:
1. Introduction to statistics and Data Analysis
2. Basic Probability Concepts
3. Random Variables and Probability Distributions
4. Mathematical Expectation
5. Some Discrete Probability Distributions
6. Some Continuous Probability Distributions
7. Functions of Random Variables
8. Fundamental Sampling Distributions and Data Descriptions
9. One- and Two- Sample Estimation Problems
10. One- and Two- Sample Tests of Hypotheses
11. Simple Linear Regression and Correlation Analysis
12 .Multiple Linear Regression and Certain Nonlinear Regression Models
13.One-Factor Experiments: General
14. Factorial Experiments (Two or More Factors)
15. 2k Factorial Experiments and Fractions
16. Nonparametric Statistics
17. Statistical Quality Control
18. Bayesian Statistics
schedule:
Week 01: Ch01~02
Week 02: Ch03~04
Week 03: Ch05~06
Week 04: Ch07~08
Week 05: Ch09
Week 06: in reserve
Week 07: Ch10
Week 08: Ch10
Week 09: Ch11
Week 10: Ch12
Week 11: Ch12
Week 12: Ch13
Week 13: in reserve
Week 14: Ch14
Week 15: Ch15
Week 16: Ch16
Week 17: Ch17
Week 18: Ch18
scorePolicy:
Homework: 40%
20 exercises approximately
Due in two weeks after assignment
Delay is not allowed
Final project: 40%
Attendance: 20%
Presence
Response
materials: Montgomery, DC, GC Runger, NF Hubele (2012): Engineering Statistics, Wiley, 5th edition (歐亞圖書代理)
